description.plain:
Normani Kordei Hamilton (born May 31, 1996), is an American singer, songwriter, dancer and actress. She spent her early years in New Orleans before her family relocated to Houston, Texas after Hurricane Katrina in 2005.

She recorded her first single at 13 years old and was featured in a Southwest airlines commercial for Black History Month before auditioning for the X Factor in 2012 and getting grouped together with Camila Cabello, Lauren Jauregui, Ally Brooke, and Dinah Jane to form a multi-platinum girl group Fifth Harmony. Together they’ve released chart-topping singles “Worth It” and “Work From Home”.

Normani embarked on her solo career in 2018 with “Love Lies”, a duet with Khalid for the Love, Simon soundtrack. She also released a two-song EP with Calvin Harris and collaborated with artists including 6LACK on her single “Waves”, Sam Smith on the Brit Awards-nominated “Dancing With a Stranger”, and Ariana Grande and Nicki Minaj on “Bad To You” for the 2019 Charlie’s Angels soundtrack.

She released “Motivation” as the lead single for her debut album in 2019. However, in 2021 she released “Wild Side” with Cardi B as the new lead single. Finally, after many delays, in 2024 Normani announced her debut album, Dopamine and issued “1:59” featuring Gunna as the lead single.

songs.full_title: Wild Side by Normani (Ft. Cardi B)
songs.title: Wild Side

description.plain:
“Wild Side” is the first collaboration between Normani and rapper Cardi B. The single marks the beginning of Normani’s highly-anticipated era for her debut album, DOPAMINE.

A snippet of the track was posted to Normani’s social media on February 5, 2021, with the caption, “know it’s been awhile.” Five months after the teaser was posted, Normani deleted all of her posts from her Instagram account, except the teaser video, which led fans speculating an announcement was imminent.

On July 14, 2021, the release date and cover art for the track were revealed, as well as the announcement of Cardi B being featured.

Cardi, Cardi! Yo, and the fact that she was able to hop on this record, like, I kid you guys not, I was already in rehearsal. I was already in rehearsal for the music video and I’m like, yo, like, not even with this record and mine, but I’m thinking, like, I’ve gotta do something with her. What record? Like, how can we make this happen? And it just so happened, Kollin [Normani & Cardi’s stylist], hit me up and was like, “Actually, that Wild Side record…” She was like, “Is it that Wild Side record? I wanna be a part of that Wild Side record. I wanna hop on that.” And the shit happened and she delivered while we were in rehearsal. So while we were rehearsing, we actually didn’t have the verse yet and then we got the verse and the shit just happened.“ – Normani via Instagram Live

songs.full_title: Motivation by Normani
songs.title: Motivation

description.plain:
In “Motivation”, Normani wants to keep her lover invested on her by keeping him “motivated” and giving him “innovation”.  The song was first teased on August 2, 2019,  when Normani posted a snippet of the track on her Twitter. She later confirmed during a Rolling Stone Morning Sessions interview that Ariana Grande co-wrote the song. Normani had been Ariana’s opening act for the better part of 2019.

“Motivation” was eventually offered to Normani. The song’s upbeat vibe was everything she had been yearning for:

I was looking for […] a song that would let me showcase everything I’m capable of from a performance stand­point, and with this song, I realised I had the opportunity to do that

songs.full_title: Waves by Normani & 6LACK
songs.title: Waves

description.plain:
First performed during her set at TIDAL-X, “Waves” premiered on Beats1 Radio along with promise of a debut album to come early 2019. The song is accompanied by a music video, which released on February 12, 2019.

On the moody R&B jam, Normani and 6LACK, fresh off dropping his own East Atlanta Love Letter, team up to conquer the tumultuous nature of on-again-off-again relationships. In an interview to Billboard, Normani said that she felt this song pointed to a new direction in R&B:

I feel like we’re taking a different direction, especially musically in the R&B space. And I think that “Waves” definitely does set the tone for the direction that we are taking.

songs.full_title: Candy Paint by Normani
songs.title: Candy Paint

description.plain:
The uptempo, Texas inspired song “Candy Paint” is the third single to Normani’s Dopamine.

A first preview of the track surfaced after it was played at a release party for her March 2022 single, “Fair.” In June of that same year, Normani recorded herself singing over the first verse of the song. However, the release was delayed due to unknown circumstances, and it ended up leaked in full in early 2023. In June 2023, the song seemed to be back on track, as a snippet of it was featured in a promotional campaign for the headphone brand Bose and was further teased by Normani herself in an interview with Billboard, accompanying the partnership. Fast foward to February 2024, her official team account confirmed its spot on Normani’s debut album. It was once again teased at the end of the first album teaser a week before the song’s release.

songs.full_title: Fair by Normani
songs.title: Fair

description.plain:
“Fair” is Normani’s first single released in 2022 and the second single from her upcoming untitled debut studio album. The song is her first solo song since 2019’s “Motivation.”

This song was teased by Normani on December 31, 2021, on a tweet containing the following caption:

Dear 2022

Soon after, a pre-save link was posted on the artist’s social media, hinting that a release would be coming soon.

description.plain:
The music video for “Wild Side” features Normani’s verse for the bridge of the song, which was originally included in the song before Cardi B joined in on the track and added her verse.

On July 18, 2021, Normani confirmed on Twitter that this extended version of the song will be available to stream on streaming platforms soon, which became available on July 23, 2021.

A fan asked Normani:

You see us asking for the version with the bridge WHEN IS IT COMING WE WANT IT ON STREAMING PLATFORMS

To what she replied:

making it happen

songs.full_title: 1:59 by Normani (Ft. Gunna)

description.plain:
“1:59” marks Normani’s return after a two-year break from releasing music. It is also the second single from her debut album, Dopamine. The Gunna team-up was teased by Normani on TikTok some time after revealing her album’s name and its cover art.

The track sees Normani and Gunna going on a back-and-forth about reconnecting with a past lover and not being able to resist the attraction every time they come back.

songs.full_title: Big Boy by Normani (Ft. Starrah)
songs.title: Big Boy

description.plain:
“Big Boy” is the opening song on Normani’s Dopamine. The track is a homage to Normani’s Southern roots and even references two of the biggest influences in Southern Hip-Hop, Pimp C and Big Boi.

In late March 2024, a snippet of the song got leaked. A month later, Normani went on Instagram Live to play a longer snippet of the song confirming it would be on her debut album. That same month, The Cut confirmed the title, describing the song in an interview:

Big Boy scans like a love letter to the South with its cool bass line, leaping horns, and nods to Pimp C.

songs.full_title: All Yours by Normani
songs.title: All Yours

description.plain:
“All Yours” is the third track of Dopamine, departing from the hometown roots on the first two tracks and transitioning into Normani’s sexual liberation, a very common theme throughout the course of this project. A slow-tempo, trap-R&B record, “All Yours” explores Normani’s sexual interest in another person, expressing her willingness to bare it all.

The song’s title was revealed for Normani’s listening party on June 7, 2024, as a served alcoholic drink at the event. On June 11, 2024, the track was previewed on Normani’s promotional hotline, “Hotline 1:59.” For fans, if they called the number, a 30-second clip would play before going to voicemail.

songs.full_title: Still by Normani
songs.title: Still

description.plain:
“Still” continues Normani’s ode to her Southern roots with a trap-infused track referencing her Houston background, sampling the hip-hop single “Still Tippin’“ by Mike Jones featuring Paul Wall and Slim Thug. The song also references rapper Pimp C, similar to “Big Boy.”

“Still” continues Normani’s assertiveness, boasting herself as a sexy, free spirit relishing in her friendships, fame, and lifestyle as a Houston girl and R&B popstar.

On February 21, 2024, the day she officially announced her debut album and revealed the album cover, Normani previewed the track on an Instagram live with her manager, and her fellow producer TBHits. Initially, the singer was uncertain about including the song on the album, and she and TBHits allowed her fans in the live to choose between “Still” and another song to be considered for the final tracklist.

songs.full_title: Insomnia by Normani
songs.title: Insomnia

description.plain:
“Insomnia” is the sixth track off Normani’s debut album DOPAMINE. Inspired by the Brandy song “A Capella (Something’s Missing)”, the song features backing vocals from Brandy herself, as well as Victoria Monét (who both also co-wrote the song).

The song sees Normani singing about an ex-lover and their attempt to reconnect with her as she’s moving on. Normani realises how it has since made her reminisce more about their past relationship, now struggling to get over it.

songs.full_title: Black Woman by Normani
songs.title: Black Woman

description.plain:
Written by Normani, hitmaker Victoria Monét, and R&B producer Danja, “Black Woman” was mentioned by Normani in an interview with Rolling Stones back in September of 2020. She teased a line of the track when asked what song or lyric she wrote she was particularly proud of.

It would have to be the line: “You’re beautiful, your blessing is growing up to be a black woman.” It will possibly be on my next project. That’s just a line that I’m really proud of, and Victoria Monet, she went in on this song. It really just started with a conversation [between us].

songs.full_title: Tantrums by Normani (Ft. James Blake)
songs.title: Tantrums

description.plain:
“Tantrums” is the eleventh track from DOPAMINE, featuring  musician James Blake. The track is a haunting, experimental R&B track where Normani ends a tumultuous relationship with a past lover.

According to Normani’s interview with Spotify via her artist profile page, “Tantrums” is her favorite track from the album. In multiple interviews, she best described the track as an ability to “flex” her taste in music, praising Blake’s artistry. In 2019, Normani and Blake exchanged interactions on X, expressing their adoration for each other after hinting they worked in the studio together during the recording of her debut album.

description.plain:
Member of Fifth Harmony, Normani Kordei shows off her vocal talent on her second solo work with this mash-up of Drake’s “Fake Love” and “Sneakin'”. She previously covered Tory Lanez’s “Say It”.

The singer slows down two of Drake’s most recent hits, with her sultry vocals and personalized verses.

songs.full_title: Grip by Normani
songs.title: Grip

description.plain:
“Grip” is the 8th track on Normani’s debut album “Dopamine”.

The song is a Pop-R&B self-love anthem where Normani celebrates confidence, independence, and self-love. She embraces her physical appearance, enjoys her lifestyle, and exudes a powerful presence that captivates others. She values her attractiveness, maturity, and authenticity, and lives life unapologetically. The song emphasizes self-assuredness and the ability to get what she wants, likening her influence and charm to that of the iconic rapper Biggie Smalls.

description.plain:
“Distance” is the 10th track on Normani’s debut album “Dopamine”.

The song is an R&B ballad in which Normani reflects on the realization that the relationship is not fulfilling due to her partner’s emotional unavailability, leading her to decide on maintaining a distance for self-preservation.

description.plain: “Sing To You” is a song recorded by Normani which surfaced online September 5, 2013 via  UMusicians. The song was produced by The Invaders. It was confirmed by Andrea (Normani’s mother) via Twitter, that “Sing To You” was not a Fifth Harmony song. Merely, the song was something she worked on during her vocal training.

description.plain:
Again, the Fifth Harmony member Normani Kordei, deliver us another cover/mashup filled with harmonies and amazing vocals.

This cover is the follow up to her second one, Fake Love x Sneakin' by Drake.

This is her third solo cover she has uploaded and it also has been produced by The Invaders.

Fans have freaked out so much about this cover saying it’s her best solo project so far, that also Solange itself heard about it and liked Normani’s tweet with the song on Twitter.
